--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Scott Stirling" <scottstirling@r...> 
wrote:
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@d...]
> >
> > Scott:
> >
> > Have you identified how a test-driven class implements a FSM? If 
I give
> > you some code that I test-drove, would you try identifying how 
it is a
> > FSM? That would be very interesting.
> 
> I'd be willing to try.  I would be interested to have an example 
that's not
> my own or borrowed out of a book.  But I'm working with a few book 
examples
> right now, trying to sort things out and see how far I can take 
this FSM
> idea.

The key I've found is to test for the effect of the machine rather 
than the machine itself. If a transition triggers an email, go make 
sure the email got sent, don't test the machine afterwards to make 
sure you got to the right end state.

Kent
